"title": "6 Creator Studio tools that help optimize Facebook video"
column8: we published tried-and-true best practices for video on Facebook based on feedback from the creator community. Many of the tools within Creator Studio can help you follow these guidelines to achieve your goals. (If you aren\u2019t already familiar
column9: Creator Studio is our one-stop-shop to upload
column10: compose and post all your Facebook content.) SMART CROP & SMART PREVIEWSmart Crop can help you reframe and size the aspect ratios of your videos from 16:9 (horizontal) to either 1:1 or 4:5 for feed.Why does that matter? People watch videos on mobile just inches from their face and often in vertical orientation
column11: rather than turning their phone to landscape. Cropping vertically also takes up more space on a viewer\u2019s mobile screen
column12: capturing attention and keeping distractions at bay.With Smart Crop
column13: cropping can be done for you using machine learning. The tool optimizes for the main subject in the content
column14: keeping them centered and in-frame. It prioritizes content that is most likely to catch people\u2019s attention
column15: such as human faces
column16: high-contrast areas and prominent text.You can review the reframed video prior to publishing
column17: compare the reframed version with the original to decide which version you\u2019d like to publish and finally
column18: publish directly within Creator Studio. Using Smart Crop allows you to: Save time when reframing the sizes of your videos manually.Reduce the amount of work it takes to optimize videos.Potentially see increased video performance (i.e. improve engagement and keep viewers watching longer).Just as Smart Crop uses machine learning to keep areas of interest visible in your crop
column19: Smart Preview
column20: another tool available within Creator Studio
column21: uses machine learning to identify the part of your video that people are likely to find most interesting and cut it into a 10-second clip.That clip is then added to the beginning of the video (a reminder that adding a trailer to the beginning of long-form video is a best practice) which may spark viewer interest and keep them watching longer.If you schedule or save your video as a draft
column22: you\u2019ll be able to review its Smart Preview and adjust or discard it before your video is set to publish. If you want to publish your video immediately
column23: the Smart Preview will generate and be inserted at the beginning of the video after publishing.STORY HIGHLIGHT CLIPPING TOOLPromoting your video content in Stories is a clever way of extending your reach and potentially increasing views. It is also
column24: you guessed it
column25: a best practice.Our story highlight clipping tool allows you to create clips up to 20 seconds long from published videos and share them directly to Facebook Stories. You can either select clips manually or use machine learning-suggested clips. The Stories clip will be posted with a \u201cSee More\u201d button that will drive viewers back to your original video.This feature can be accessed by going to Creator Studio and navigating to the \u201cPublished\u201d tab.POST TESTINGWhile you know your audience best
column26: testing different versions of your videos can help you optimize performance
column27: understand what kinds of content resonates and discover trends
column28: so you can make informed decisions about future posts.Post Testing in Creator Studio lets you test up to four variants of a post to see which one your audience likes best. You can test different edits of a video
column29: different descriptions
column30: headlines and thumbnails\u2013both pre-determined and manually-uploaded options. You also get to choose the metric that\u2019ll determine the \u201cwinner\u201d such as 1-minute views
column31: comments
column32: shares
column33: reactions
column34: people reached and link clicks.During the test
column35: the posts are circulated to a subset of your audience but are not posted to your Page. You choose how long you want the test to run for. When the test ends
column36: the most successful variant is automatically published on your Page. AUTO-CAPTIONS & SUBTITLESCaptions make your content more accessible and can grab the attention of people who watch videos with sound turned off. When captions are added to your video
column37: they may increase your video\u2019s watch time and distribution\u2013naturally
column38: a best practice.To help you save time
column39: Facebook automatically generates captions when you upload your video. By default
column40: auto-generated captions are turned on for all of your video content
column41: though you can manually turn them off on a Page-level or on an individual video.While captions are generated in the same language spoken in the video
column42: subtitles open your content up to new audiences in other regions and languages
column43: thus extending potential global distribution.When auto-generated subtitles are enabled
column44: viewers have the option to watch your content with subtitles in one of 11 most-commonly watched languages on Facebook: English
column45: Indonesian Bahasa
column46: Spanish (Latin America)
column47: Hindi
column48: Vietnamese
column49: Tagalog
column50: Brazilian Portuguese
column51: Standard Arabic
column52: Urdu
column53: Tamil and Telugu.Note that the auto-generated subtitles will only work with videos that do not currently have burned-in captions
column54: so that the captions can be auto-generated through the closed captioning feature.\u201cWe often see subtitled videos performing better than non-subtitled videos
column55: and we also know that a large proportion of our audience are based in non-English speaking countries so this could make our content more engaging for them.\u201d\u2013 Sky SportsLearn more:3 video best practices to try on FacebookNew ways to engage your audience and build communityUnlock your creativity with Reels on FacebookCommitting to creating and earning sustainable income on Facebook*Generally expected individual results will differ."}

column8: Facebook launched Subscriptions
column9: which has helped creators build sustainable businesses powered by the support of their communities. Based on strong creator feedback
column10: we\u2019re ready to now bring this business model to creators on Instagram.With Instagram Subscriptions
column11: creators can develop deeper connections with their most engaged followers and grow their recurring monthly income by giving subscribers access to exclusive content and benefits
column12: all within the same platform where they interact with them already. Starting today
column13: we\u2019re beginning to test subscriptions with a handful of creators who will be able to set a monthly price of their choice
column14: unlock a \u201csubscribe\u201d button on their profile and offer the following benefits to their subscribers: Subscriber Lives: Creators can broadcast exclusive Lives to their subscribers
column15: allowing them to engage more deeply. Subscriber Stories: Creators can create stories just for their subscribers
column16: allowing them to share exclusive content and to use interactive story stickers with their most engaged followers only.Subscriber Badges: Creators will see a subscriber badge next to comments and messages so they can easily identify their subscribers.  While the feature will only be available to a limited number of US creators during this initial test
column17: we have plans to expand access to more creators over the next few months. If you want to see Subscriptions in action
column18: you can follow and subscribe to these creators: @alanchikinchow
column19: @sedona._
column20: @alizakelly
column21: @kelseylynncook
column22: @elliottnorris
column23: @jordanchiles
column24: @jackjerry
column25: @bunnymichael
column26: @donalleniii and @lonnieiiv.Having subscriptions on Instagram makes building a more intimate relationship with my followers and fans possible. I am so excited to nurture those connections and make a lasting impact that will help keep my work sustainable.@bunnymichaelEarlier this year
column27: as part of our continued commitment to supporting creators
column28: we shared that Meta would not collect any fees from creators on Facebook Subscriptions purchases until 2023 at the earliest
column29: and this will also apply to Instagram Subscriptions. Additionally
column30: we believe that you should know your audience and have more control over your business. We hope to build the tools to allow you to also directly connect with your audience off platform in the future.Facebook Subscriptions UpdatesIn November 2021
column31: we announced that Facebook Fan Subscriptions would be renamed Subscriptions
column32: alongside several exciting updates:Delivering greater creator control: As of December
column33: Subscriptions creators can download emails of new subscribers (who have agreed to share their email addresses) so they can maintain a relationship off of Facebook.Helping creators keep more of what they earn: Creators can now use a personalized link to promote their subscription that allows them to keep 100% of the money they earn
column34: excluding taxes. In the coming months
column35: creators will gain access to new metrics about their estimated earnings that will show where their purchases come from
column36: estimated taxes and how much they pay to Apple and others in fees.Bonus programs: As part of Meta's $1 billion investment in creators
column37: select Subscriptions creators were invited to a bonus program that rewarded them for new subscribers. This was the first of several bonus programs for Facebook Subscriptions that will launch in the coming months.We continue to invest in these tools and will have more exciting updates to share in the coming months."}

column3: "title": "Learn How Donnalyn Earned Over 7 Million Followers in One Year"
column7: "post_text": "Increase in followers by over 7.7M to hit a total of 13.4M from Jul 2020 to Jul 2021* 40% year-on-year growth in overall engagements comparing Q3 2020 to Q3 2021** 40% YoY growth in comments comparing Q3 2020 to Q3 2021***Based on public data from CrowdTangle
column8: July 2020 to July 2021 **Creator Studio data. Based on activity occurring from Q3 2020 and Q3 2021 GOALSDonnalyn hoped to: Grow and strengthen her community on Facebook Increase engagementTHE CHALLENGEAfter Donnalyn garnered a Facebook following of 4 million by posting a mix of song and dance covers and some beauty content
column9: she did not see any significant growth for three years and was unsure of how to attract more followers effectively. THE STRATEGYSeeking GuidanceDonnalyn turned to Facebook to learn how she could engage more people on the platform and break through the stagnation in growth. By working together
column10: Donnalyn learned more about Facebook best practices and how to apply insights from Creator Studio to her content strategy in a way that can fuel growth. When I noticed a drop-off in my growth rate on Facebook
column11: I felt as if I had hit a wall \u2013 but after partnering with Facebook
column12: applying best practices
column13: and engaging with fans more authentically
column14: I\u2019ve seen a huge increase in my followers and am closer to them than ever beforeDonnalynPutting Audience Insights in ActionAfter gaining a deeper understanding of her audience demographics and video performance by studying the insights available from Creator Studio
column15: Donnalyn pivoted her content strategy so that she could engage with her followers in more genuine ways. After discovering that many of her followers were young women
column16: she began sharing more personal life experiences
column17: such as the time she went to the dentist to have her braces removed
column18: how she interacts with her siblings
column19: anecdotes about romantic relationships
column20: and quotes that have been important to her throughout her life. She also hosted giveaways and touched on topics she found interesting
column21: including trends
column22: games
column23: and pranks \u2013 such as the time she called a friend and said she shaved her eyebrows off \u2013 which helped her reach a new audience and convert them to followers.In addition
column24: Donnalyn reviewed the viewer retention metrics on her videos and realized that the videos people watched longest were those with better technical quality. Using this insight
column25: she upgraded her recording equipment to improve the audio-visual experience and adjusted her editing style to keep viewers watching until the end.Developing a Consistent Content SchedulePrior to her partnership with Facebook
column26: Donnalyn posted videos erratically which meant her audience did not know when to expect new content from her
column27: so viewing behavior was inconsistent.Using insights from Creator Studio and following Facebook best practices
column28: Donnalyn began posting videos more consistently \u2013 up to four times per week \u2013 and saw the viewing habits of her fans become more consistent as well.Capitalizing on AuthenticityTo deepen the connection with her followers
column29: Donnalyn introduced more authentic content into her strategy. This included videos that gave fans a glimpse into her daily life
column30: Facebook Live events several times per month
column31: and posts to Facebook Stories and Instagram Stories to share quick updates. Beyond this
column32: Donnalyn also took the time to respond personally to comments fans left on her content
column33: deepening her connection with them.Beyond fans
column34: she also follows and interacts with many other public figures and well known creators. Donnalyn takes the time to interact with their Facebook Pages
column35: sharing sentiments her fans also love to watch. This approach helped Donnalyn attract more than 7.7 million followers in approximately one year
column36: attract brand collaborations and partnerships
column37: build trust
column38: and earn loyalty. The marked growth Facebook helped Donnalyn achieve has also helped her open her own business and continue to find new ventures.Top Tips from Donnalyn1Create a content schedule: Rather than posting at random
column39: create a publishing schedule based on audience insights from Creator Studio and stick to it.2Understand your audience and connect with their interests: Get to know your audience through both insights from Creator Studio and by engaging them in conversations. This will help you gain first-hand knowledge about their passions and interests
column40: and will help steer you in the direction of content topics that appeal to them on a personal level.3Don\u2019t be afraid to introduce new topics: Branching out to create content that is a new genre or category for you can help you reach a new audience and attract new followers. 4Always be yourself: Keep in mind that people follow you because they\u2019re interested in learning more about you and enjoy interacting with your content. Be authentic
column41: engage with them
column42: and let them get to know who you really are \u2013 it goes a long way in deepening your connection with your fans.I started from the bottom and did not get to where I am right away. I\u2019ve always felt like an amateur
column43: which made me strive to improve what I do. When you acknowledge that you always have room for improvement and believe you can always do better
column44: you will!Donnalyn"}

column3: "title": "Introducing Professional Mode for Profiles | Meta for Creators"
column7: "post_text": "Professional mode for profilesWe want creators to reach their full potential on Facebook and that means giving you ways to earn money and providing insights so you can understand what types of posts resonate with your community. Until now
column8: these tools were only available on Pages. We know that many creators -- especially those who are just starting out -- are on profiles
column9: so we\u2019re introducing a professional mode for profiles in the US. With professional mode
column10: eligible creators will be able to unlock revenue opportunities and gain access to tools to help grow their audience.Notably
column11: one of the first monetization options available with professional mode for profiles will be the Reels Play bonus program
column12: which allows eligible creators to earn bonuses based on the views of their qualifying reels. To start with
column13: the program is invite only. Interested creators can sign up to learn more and visit our Meta for Creators blog to learn best practices for creating reels.We\u2019re excited to enable more people to earn money from their reels
column14: like the engaging videos we\u2019ve seen from creators like Hammy and Olivia and Hakim Collins and we\u2019re continuing to build out features for Reels on Facebook
column15: such as making it easier to compose a video from selecting multiple clips
column16: the ability to save your reel mid-creation as a draft and the ability to create a longer
column17: 60-second reel
column18: which will all be available soon. We also look forward to expanding Reels to more countries next year.Professional mode also opens up access to post
column19: audience and profile insights -- similar to what you can find on Pages today. For example
column20: you can see the total number of shares
column21: reactions and comments that posts have and review your follower growth over time.Once you turn on professional mode for your profile
column22: anyone can follow you and see your public content in their feed
column23: but you\u2019ll still be in control of who sees what content you share. That means you can share public updates
column24: or decide to share content with just your friends
column25: too.This new mode is testing with a limited number of profiles today in the US
column26: and feedback has been encouraging so far. \u201cIn just a few weeks of testing
column27: professional mode has been fantastic. Within two weeks
column28: I\u2019ve built up more than $10K in Reels Play bonus earnings
column29: so as a full-time content creator
column30: the potential around monetization and follower growth is huge.\u201d\u2013 Hakim CollinsWe\u2019ll expand to more people in the US soon
column31: more countries in the coming months and add more tools and capabilities over time
column32: including access to more monetization options and other platform tools.Updates to the New Pages ExperienceFor creators who use Pages
column33: we\u2019ve added new features to the new Pages experience we rolled out earlier this year
column34: including a Professional Dashboard that serves as a central destination for admins to review their Page's performance and access professional tools and insights. We\u2019re also running a limited test of a new unit at the top of the feed that will provide a snapshot of your post engagement and follower count
column35: as well as tips on how to create high performing content. We\u2019re also testing an updated post composer that brings a variety of creator-focused features to Facebook. The initial test will include the ability to easily schedule posts. This feature was previously only available on Facebook Business Suite
column36: so with this update
column37: we\u2019re making it possible for creators to schedule posts regardless of their existing workflow and which tool or app they're using."}

column7: "post_text": "Roccibella got started on Facebook in 2015 \u201cwhile looking for new opportunities for myself
column8: \u201d she said. \u201cI\u2019m an accountant
column9: but as an immigrant to the US
column10: I was faced with a new reality and forced to reinvent myself. I started off recording simple makeup tutorials with my phone
column11: and since it seemed to get some interest from my small and growing community
column12: I kept doing it.\u201d\u201cToday
column13: so much has changed but the foundation of it all is the same: I\u2019m still shooting content for my community and fostering the beautiful connection that we have.\u201d STRATEGYPrior to her strategy shift in late March of 2021
column14: Roccibella went live on Facebook sporadically. Since then
column15: however
column16: she goes live at least four times a week to share an authentic
column17: unfiltered version of herself with her fans. Some of her videos are over an hour long but her live streams have the highest average interaction rate of all content types for her Page
column18: according to CrowdTangle. Tip 1: Show the whole process
column19: mistakes and all\u201cAs of April of this year
column20: I made a big shift in my content strategy because I felt my community really wanted to see more organic content without so much editing or planning. Just me
column21: no filter
column22: \u201d Roccibella said.\u201cThis realization made me shift towards a live video-focused strategy
column23: because it really made me feel so much closer to my audience; it\u2019s real-time
column24: no filters and with lots of authentic mishaps. I felt like this was the most important thing for my community
column25: to really show them how to actually fix makeup mistakes in real-time
column26: versus showing them a perfectly edited process.\u201d "}

It feels like I'm having a video call with them.\u201dCandy has also found that picking out a message that feels authentic to her\u2013one of encouragement and self love\u2013has helped her connect with her followers while staying true to herself. Pattino da quando ho 6 anni e
column9: quando il lavoro \u00e8 diventato troppo stressante per me

column11: durante i quali ho pattinato tantissimo. Un giorno un amico mi ha fatto un video e io l'ho pubblicato su Facebook. In 24\u00a0ore ho ricevuto pi\u00f9 di 8000 visualizzazioni. column3: "title": "Community News Project expands to 100 reporters with $8m/\u00a35.9m in new funding | Meta Journalism Project"
"title": "How Brand-safe content helped Lovely Family TV increase revenue"
column7: "post_text": "RESULTS Lovely Family TV reported the following results: 1.3 billion video views*12X increase in in-stream ad revenue** 4.5X increase in followers*** 3.2X increase in returning viewers***public data from CrowdTangle (September 2020\u2013September 2021) **data from QBR (September 2021 compared to September 2020) ***public data from CrowdTangle (September 2020-September 2021 compared to previous year-on-year) GOALS Lovely Family TV aimed to: Post more videos each weekAttract more followersIncrease ad revenueAPPROACH To appeal to as many people as possible
column8: the Lovely Family TV team ensures its episodes provide family-friendly and brand-safe content that does not include strong language
column9: depictions of objectionable activities or explicit scenes. By closely following the Facebook community guidelines and Partner Monetization policies
column10: the team is able to maximize monetization opportunities. In addition
column11: they maintain a consistent content cadence
column12: posting six videos per week
column13: which helps to keep fans engaged with their Facebook Page on a near daily basis.STRATEGY Lovely Family TV used a variety of Facebook tools to gain insights into the type of content its audience enjoys
column14: organize its videos and generate revenue. Content that resonates with fan Understanding which videos its audiences enjoys most is important to Lovely Family TV. To learn more about their reach and which videos are earning the highest views in the first minute
column15: the team uses Meta Creator Studio. The Lovely Family TV team also uses Meta Creator Studio Performance Insights to monitor comments and engagement on their videos. This helps them pinpoint the type of content their fans enjoy watching and interacting with. They use this data to create a roadmap for the type of content they produce and post next.Making it easy to keep watching Posting six videos per week means that Lovely Family TV produces a lot of content! To help fans find an easy starting point
column16: the team uses Playlists to organize videos by theme
column17: and ensure each video includes a compelling title and thought-provoking caption. By taking the time to organize content
column18: Lovely Family TV has generated over 196 million views collectively from the 51 videos in its three Playlists.Posting brand-safe videos Lovely Family TV\u2019s commitment to creating an episodic drama that can be enjoyed by the whole family
column19: one that is centered on social responsibility
column20: and doing so consistently
column21: has helped the team attract more advertising opportunities via in-stream ads. Beyond this
column22: it also means new viewers are more likely to discover Lovely Family TV\u2019s videos on Facebook. 5 Tips From Lovely Family TV1Freshness is key: Staying current with the latest cultural moments in Thailand helps the team create episodes that are on-the-pulse with trends and resonant with audiences.2Keep it relatable: Basing content on real-life situations and personalities helps fans connect with Lovely Family TV\u2019s storyline and increases the likelihood of engagement and shareability. 3Tightly edited videos: Lovely Family TV\u2019s editing style ensures the plot
column23: dialogue and pacing of each video is sharp and straight-to-the-point
column24: which helps keep the viewer\u2019s attention.4The first 15 seconds matter: Use Meta Creator Studio to track how many people watch the first minute of your content and strive to capture their attention in the first 15 seconds.5Make it brand safe: Follow Facebook community guidelines and partner monetization policies to help boost discoverability and opportunities to earn in-stream ad revenue.\u201cAs a team of independent creators who act
column25: direct
column26: write and edit our own videos
column27: the ability to learn how our content performs and make adjustments based on data-driven insights has been paramount to our success.\u201dLovely Family TV"}

column7: "post_text": "L'intervista \u00e8 stata riassunta e modificata per maggiore chiarezza.Come hai iniziato a usare Facebook?Ho creato la mia Pagina nel 2012

column12: ho iniziato pubblicando contenuti da Instagram a Facebook con la funzione di cross-posting. La creazione della Pagina \u00e8 stata lenta e ha richiesto un po' di tempo. La mia strategia su ciascuna piattaforma
column13: tra cui Facebook
column14: si \u00e8 molto evoluta negli ultimi 1
column15: 5-2 anni

column17: il modo in cui li creiamo e il motivo per cui li condividiamo. I video in genere hanno come protagonista chi li crea
column18: sono in prima persona e vengono realizzati per mostrare le esperienze personali. Parlaci della tua decisione.L'obiettivo era colmare un vuoto con i miei contenuti. In quanto donna con disabilit\u00e0
column19: mi trovo ad affrontare ancora tanta ignoranza: mancano la conoscenza
column20: la consapevolezza e l'educazione tra le persone. Nessuno ci ha insegnato come trattare l'argomento della disabilit\u00e0. La mia generazione \u00e8 cresciuta sentendosi dire \"Non guardare
column21: non fissare e non fare domande\"
column22: che \u00e8 la cosa peggiore che si possa insegnare ai giovani. Ne \u00e8 scaturita una generazione che evita la disabilit\u00e0 e ne ha addirittura paura. Ma quella delle persone con disabilit\u00e0 \u00e8 l'unica minoranza di cui si pu\u00f2 entrare a far parte in qualsiasi momento
column23: in conseguenza di malattie o incidenti. Per questo \u00e8 importante riempire quel vuoto e spazzare via la paura
column24: e il modo migliore per farlo \u00e8 essere umani. Mostrare alle persone il lato umano della disabilit\u00e0. In genere i media cadono nella retorica della commiserazione o mettono le persone con disabilit\u00e0 su un piedistallo. Io voglio mostrarne il lato umano: posso essere tua sorella

column26: una collega. Amo lo yoga e i gatti
column27: il sushi e la moda. Il modo migliore di condividere chi sono \u00e8 attraverso la creazione di contenuti in prima persona. Se mi conosci come persona
column28: ti viene voglia di sapere di pi\u00f9 della mia disabilit\u00e0
column29: di quali sono le difficolt\u00e0 e le ingiustizie che affrontiamo come comunit\u00e0. "}

column3: "title": "Creator Spotlight: 4EVE"
column7: "post_text": "How would you describe your creative work? Are you surprised it has resonated with the number of people it has? The key to our creative work is anything that\u2019s light-hearted and guaranteed to put a smile on our audience\u2019s faces. At first
column8: it took us by surprise that our content has reached quite a number of people \u2013 way more than we expected. We\u2019re so thankful for that. Knowing that our music and performances cheer up our fans and brighten their days is definitely the best thing any Creator could ask for.What gives you confidence when you\u2019re in Creator mode? Seeing the support and appreciation from our fans
column9: as well as encouragement from the other members. Which Facebook Reaction best describes you? The laughing emoji resonated with us the most because we like to joke around with each other. Almost everyone close to us knows we\u2019re goofballs!What\u2019s a cause you\u2019re all passionate about \u2014 and do you feel your work contributes to it? Staying true to who you are and loving what you do is the key to happiness. We\u2019re very blessed to have the opportunity to turn our passion for music into reality. What Creator trends would you like to see more of? We live in such a beautiful world of cultural diversity
column10: and we would love to see a wider variety in styles and fashion in the music industry. There are probably really interesting things that we haven\u2019t seen yet
column11: even on social media! A huge thank you to 4EVE for chatting with us! To learn more about the group and their music

column3: "title": "Announcing the second year of We The Culture"
column7: "post_text": "The We The Culture program aims to elevate Black creators
column8: spark community and empower them to build successful
column9: entertaining and sustainable networks across our technologies.We\u2019re excited to share that we\u2019re extending We The Culture for a second year. From now until December 6
column11: Black creators can apply to be part of the We The Culture program. Selected participants will receive an opportunity for content funding and access to education and development
column12: product support and community building resources. Visit the application page to find eligibility requirements
column13: read the terms and apply.Creators to watch We The Culture creators have developed an extensive range of programming that celebrates the diversities of what it means to be Black. They\u2019ve built compelling content
column14: sparking communities across different experiences and interests\u2014and they have more rolling out soon. Here are 3 new series to look out for this fall:Hella Black with Tobe & Fat: A docuseries that follows the lives of hip hop\u2019s fastest-rising stars as they live together
column15: work together
column16: raise their family together and freestyle the Black American dream before our eyes. Behind the Curtain with H.E.R.: An up close and personal look into rarely seen day to day life of an artist. The many demands
column17: commitments
column18: along with the fun creating a balanced life. It will follow H.E.R. and her movements as she attempts to balance the hustle and bustle of a reopened industry as well as the new levels and expectations in her career.Talks with Mama Tina
column19: premiering in mid-late November: A conversation series hosted by Tina Knowles Lawson. No stranger to social media
column20: Mama Tina is using her platform to share advice from a mother\u2019s perspective to Millennials and Gen Z. Talks With Mama Tina provides an exclusively candid forum for open and honest conversation
column21: reaching audiences from teens to those in their prime.Our commitment to Black creators We are committed to helping Black creators scale their creativity
column22: grow their community and build a business across our technologies. To celebrate and lift voices from the Black community
column23: we\u2019ve been using We The Culture social channels across Facebook
column24: Instagram
column25: Twitter and YouTube. From launching the Get Into series where we sit down and chat one-on-one with a Black creator
column26: to spotlighting 7 Black-owned businesses during Black Business Month
column27: We The Culture will continue to create a space for those shaping the next generation of Black culture. And we know we have much more work to do. With the second year of the We The Culture program
column28: we look forward to providing more opportunities for Black creators and continuing to amplify a wide spectrum of voices. Visit the application page to learn about eligibility and how you can apply."}

column3: "title": "Best practices for optimizing your video on Facebook"
column7: "post_text": "Take your pre-existing long-form content and create a 3 min \u201cFacebook cut.\u201dLeverage your existing library and cut longer videos down to 3 minutes. It\u2019s a win-win: you get to maximize your assets and test out new formats that may pull in new viewers and increase retention (think recaps
column8: highlight reel
column9: \u201cbest of\u201d and more).Add a 15 second trailer to long-form videos.The first few seconds of every video are critical. Think of your own content consumption habits: As you scroll
column10: what grabs your attention? Visually appealing imagery
column11: fast paced clips and a quick intro into what you are about to watch. To that end
column12: try clipping a 15-second trailer to add to the beginning of your video to capture viewers and increase retention. Moreover
column13: 15-second trailers have shown to drive better engagement than five second trailers.Reframe your 16:9 videos into 4:5.Frame your visual story and build for vertical format. People watch videos on mobile just inches from their face and often in vertical orientation
column14: rather than turning their phone to landscape
column15: which makes 4:5 the recommended aspect ratio for video on Facebook.Pro tip: Smart Crop is a tool within Meta Creator Studio that will reframe and size the aspect ratios of your videos from 16:9 (horizontal) to either 1:1 (square) or 4:5 (vertical) for feed. It optimizes for the main subject in the content
column16: keeping the main subjects centered and in-frame. We know it takes a lot of work to edit multiple sizing variations across platforms\u2013with Smart Crop
column17: you can automatically edit your video for the sizes you need.Keep your descriptions succinct.Keeping your video descriptions to one sentence can help increase your engagement
column18: compared to longer descriptions of three sentences or more. People want to know what they\u2019re getting into so be direct
column19: explicit and descriptive.A/B test your videos to learn what resonates.Testing different versions of your videos can help you optimize performance
column20: understand what kinds of content resonates with your audience and discover trends so you can make informed decisions about future posts.Post Testing in Meta Creator Studio (under \u201cContent Library\u201d) lets you test up to four variants of a post to see which one your audience likes best. You can test different edits of a video
column21: different descriptions
column22: headlines and thumbnails\u2013both pre-determined and manually-uploaded options.During the test
column23: the posts are circulated to a subset of your audience but are not posted to your Page. You choose how long you want the test to run for. When the test ends
column24: the winning post is automatically published on your Page and distributed to your full audience. You also get to choose the metric that\u2019ll determine the \u201cwinner\u201d such as 1-minute views
column25: comments
column26: shares
column27: reactions
column28: people reached and link clicks. The \u201cPost Testing\u201d tab is your central hub for creating and managing tests
column29: and reviewing insights.Keep viewers coming back by letting them know when you\u2019ll post next.Get your fans used to your posting cadence by announcing your schedule and urging them to come back for your next video. This can increase return viewers and retention. In the days leading up to your next scheduled video
column30: use Stories to build anticipation
column31: go live to talk about what viewers can expect
column32: use a countdown and follow-up soon after your video is published with a Q&A
column33: bloopers or behind-the-scenes tidbits to delight your audience.Respond to comments.When people comment on your posts
column34: they hope that you will actually see it. When you respond to these comments
column35: it helps remind your audience that you are really there which can incentivize more people to comment. More comments can lead to more distribution and an active
column36: thriving community. And while you\u2019re at it
column37: don\u2019t stop at your own posts. Commenting on content from other accounts can lead to follower growth. Put simply
column38: it helps get your name in front of more people.Reshare your videos within two hours after publishing them.Soon after you publish
column39: reshare your video within two hours to both your timeline and your Stories. This distribution strategy can help increase both retention and views.Don\u2019t sleep on captions.Not only do captions make your content more accessible
column40: they can also grab the attention of people who watch video with sound turned off. Experiment with captions throughout your video to see if they drive retention. If you start your video off with a trailer
column41: make sure there are subtitles then too. Pro tip: While burned-in subtitles are recommended
column42: Meta Creator Studio can help you generate auto-captions in a pinch. It automatically generates captions when you upload your video
column43: though you can choose to turn them off for all your videos or for individual videos. You can also turn on a setting that will require your review of auto-generated captions before they publish.Opt for more sophisticated call-to-action.While it may be tempting to ask fans to Like
column44: Comment and Share your videos
column45: try instead to pose open-ended questions. You\u2019ll learn more about your audience
column46: including their likes and dislikes
column47: when you ask them to open up. Similarly
column48: you can join in and respond to keep conversations going in the comments. Learn more:3 video best practices to try on Facebook5 tips for maintaining production & maximizing your contentHow to capture and retain attention: one-sheetHow to encourage return viewership: one-sheetA video performance troubleshooting guide*Generally expected individual results will differ."}

column11: Facebook dar\u00e0 loro un bonus tra 5 e 20 USD per ogni nuovo abbonato che avranno da oggi alla fine del 2021. Questo nuovo programma di bonus fa parte dell'impegno di Facebook di investire oltre 1 miliardo di USD nei creator nel corso del 2022. I creator possono guadagnare un bonus fino a 10 000 USD nel corso del programma. Il programma \u00e8 solo su invito e valido in tutti i 27 mercati in cui \u00e8 disponibile la funzione Abbonamenti. Speriamo di espandere questo e altri programmi di bonus nei prossimi mesi per aiutare pi\u00f9 creator a sviluppare attivit\u00e0 sostenibili basate sugli abbonamenti su Facebook. "title": "Learn how Delta Goodrem is deepening her connection with fans"
column7: "post_text": "How would you describe your creative work; are you surprised it has resonated with the number of people it has?My creative work is a feeling and a vision \u2013 my music comes from my heart and is full of my observations of the world and how I feel in the moment. I started my career at 15 and I had no plan B. After all this time
column8: it\u2019s really exciting to still be able to discover new things
column9: put out content that really resonates with people
column10: and realise that I can still be discovered by a new audience.That said
column11: I am the most grateful for people who have stayed with me throughout the different chapters of my career. That's what surprises me! I seem to have attracted these incredibly loyal friends who understand me and my work
column12: and are very open to new discoveries as we're on this journey together.What do you feel you bring to your audiences
column13: as a Creator?I hope that I bring a lot of music
column14: positivity
column15: and love. I really enjoy the ability to share the projects I'm working on and seeing everyone's response in real time.Why is it important to you to make the content you create?Making content gives me so much freedom to express myself creatively. Whether it's creating visuals to accompany my music
column16: live streaming a performance
column17: or posting a video of me jamming on the piano
column18: I\u2019m able to show the different layers of myself and my creativity. Sharing those moments is really special and definitely makes me feel a very strong connection with the people who listen. How has Facebook and Instagram helped you deepen your connection with your fans?Facebook and Instagram have been essential to building a deeper connection with my fans. They changed the entire game by giving artists and creators opportunities to try out different formats for communicating with everyone. When we couldn't tour or perform like we used to due to COVID-19 restrictions
column19: I was still able to do live-streamed music sessions from my living room. Getting to perform this way and share the music with this audience in real time was a wonderful experience
column20: and I was able to reach and connect with so many fans around the world without leaving my home.What is a funny rumour you would like to start about yourself? If it was up to me
column21: I would start some great music rumours
column22: like that I did a song with Coldplay and BTS.Which Facebook Reaction best describes you? I would say the \"care\" reaction! The one holding and hugging a heart! I'm a very tactile person and I just love hugs.What is your vision for the future?I really just want to continue to be in arenas around the world
column23: performing songs that touch people's hearts. I am so grateful to have the platform that I do and I want to continue to use it for good.We\u2019re so grateful to Delta for chatting with us! To learn more about Delta and her music
column24: check her out on Facebook and Instagram. Watch Delta perform at #FB4Fans
column25: a free AR experience. Sign up here to join the event
column26: play some games and you could win a meet and greet with Delta.Join #FB4Fans at fb4fans.com."}

"title": "Learn how Dianxi Xiaoge\u2019s cooking videos reach millions"
column7: "post_text": "RESULTS50% increase in followers* 20% increase in engagement**20% increase in monthly revenue****between January and August 2021
column8: CrowdTangle data** Source: Creator Studio
column9: video engagement from January 2021 compared to August 2021***Source: Creator Studio
column10: between January 2021 to August 2021 GOALS Dianxi Xiaoge aimed to increase watch time
column11: grow her international community
column12: and increase revenue. THE APPROACHAppealing to food lovers  Dianxi was confident her cooking videos could break language barriers and appeal to people worldwide with a common love for food
column13: as well as to those looking to learn more about different cultures. She wanted to use Facebook to grow her global audience as well as foster a sense of community between people who enjoy her videos. THE STRATEGYNew Recipes Every Week To keep followers interested and visiting her Facebook Page on a regular basis
column14: Dianxi posts new content weekly. The videos
column15: which are typically between seven and 11 minutes
column16: show people how to prepare Yunnanese dishes according to the season
column17: and give them a glimpse into life in Yunnan. The consistency of her weekly posts ensures people know when to visit her Page and gives them something to look forward to each week.  To earn revenue
column18: Dianxi accepts fan subscriptions and includes Facebook in-stream video ads
column19: which appear as natural ad breaks in her videos. Making Use of Mouth-watering Themes Organizing content helps people find videos more easily
column20: and Dianxi and her team work to not only develop seasonal recipes
column21: but to produce themed content. This often coincides with cultural moments
column22: and her video\u2019s educational information which sheds light into Chinese culture. For Chinese New Year
column23: she published several videos about the various dishes she prepared
column24: with the best-performing video receiving over 44 million views.  Additionally
column25: Dianxi created a four-part video series dedicated to spices and featured it as a Playlist on her Facebook page
column26: making it easily accessible to her followers. Each video introduces one spice and dives deep into its origin
column27: how it\u2019s harvested
column28: and how it\u2019s incorporated into Yunnanese cuisine. Subtitles
column29: the Secret Ingredient Dianxi and her team use her Facebook Page to reach and connect with people outside of her home country.  All posts are published bilingually \u2013 in Mandarin Chinese and English \u2013 and her videos include little dialogue
column30: ensuring those who cannot understand Chinese can still follow the content with ease. Long-Form Text Posts To supplement her Wednesday videos
column31: Dianxi publishes a bilingual \u201cnote\u201d each Thursday that shares more with her audience about each dish along with the detailed recipe. This provides more context to each video and gives people insight into Yunnan
column32: Chinese culture
column33: and Dianxi\u2019s life
column34: fostering a deeper connection with her and her content. Top Tips from Dianxi Xiaoge1Create a content schedule: Establishing a routine publishing schedule helps people anticipate when your new content will be available and know when to visit your Page.2Longer-form content is viable: Videos that are longer than five minutes can keep an audience\u2019s attention if they tell a cohesive and engaging visual story. 3Add a dash of culture: Showcasing your unique culture and heritage is a great way to attract an audience. Content that helps introduce them to your life and perspective through a shared joy
column35: such as food
column36: will keep people interested and coming back for more.4Embrace multiple languages: Including post translations in one or more languages will go a long way in helping you reach a wider audience and making your content accessible.I\u2019m very grateful that Facebook helps me share the beauty and culture of Yunnan with a global audience. It\u2019s easy to post in both Mandarin and English so I can reach loyal fans and new viewers who share my love of food.Dianxi Xiaoge"}

column3: "title": "How Creators use Creator Studio Insights to optimize video | Meta for Creators"
column7: "post_text": "RESULTSKop Dinh110% increase in engagements from July-August 2021 over the previous period*46% increase in video view completions from July-August 2021 over the previous period*3x increase in 1-minute views from July-August 2021 over the previous period*Ruam Ghost91% follower growth
column8: January-August 2021**48M 1-minute views from January-August 2021
column9: a 32% increase over the previous period*2.2M engagements from January-August 2021
column10: a 40% increase over the previous period*In-stream revenue has seen a 39% increase from January-August 2021 over the previous period**According to Facebook data **According to publicly available CrowdTangle data STRATEGY Both partners set out to connect with a dedicated audience using Facebook video. Both turned to Creator Studio Insights to learn more about the content formats that resonate with their communities and identify opportunities.Video first Kop Dinh\u2019s approach to video is twofold: invest in high quality equipment to produce best in class content
column11: and share the editing process in behind-the-scenes videos for technical enthusiasts and budding videographers.  The Vietnamese creator fine-tuned his strategy in July to include sound effects to make his content more engaging
column12: and optimized for a 4:5 vertical ratio to maximize real estate on viewers\u2019 screens. Between July-August
column13: he saw a 46% increase in video view completions over the previous period
column14: and a 3x increase in 1-minute views.Kop Dinh\u2019s Top Video TipsProduce and edit compelling video
column15: coupled with sound effectsFeature places and events that would be of interest to a wide audienceOptimize for a vertical frame aspect ratio of 4:5 Similarly
column16: Ruam Ghost saw the notable difference video made in his growth strategy. The Thai creator initially started posting still imagery to his Facebook page but realized the potential video holds in connecting with more people
column17: and has since layered animation over video to engage his growing community. For Ruam Ghost
column18: tying storytelling to Thai culture and looking through comments on his videos for story ideas are integral to creating content that resonates. Ruam Ghost\u2019s Top Video TipsResearch each story in-depth before you create your videoTie video to your culture
column19: remain authenticAn unexpected twist in the story keeps the audience tuned inUse Insights as a guide Kop Dinh posts his videos using Creator Studio as this enables him to set a title
column20: captions and tags for each video
column21: pick a thumbnail and schedule posts in advance. In Creator Studio Insights
column22: he often checks the \u201cTop Videos\" section to see which videos are resonating and what he can learn from their success for future production. Video views (minutes viewed
column23: 1-minute and 3 second views) factor into his definition of success
column24: as well as new followers. This attention to detail helped his engagements increase 110% between July-August over the previous period.  \"I became more focused on growing my Facebook page with the guidance and tips received through the Meta media partnerships program and started to discover new products for building my strategies
column25: \" said Kop Dinh. Ruam Ghost said he looks at minutes viewed as well
column26: which is how he realized that longer videos garner more views for him\u2013thus resulting in him producing videos that are 12 minutes or longer. His 1-minute videos increased 32% from January-August compared to the previous period
column27: and his engagements increased 40% in that time span as well. Thematically
column28: he\u2019s noticed that stories that take place in the woods and stories that involve a certain type of \u201clocal ghost\u201d gain traction
column29: and this helps inform his content strategy. \"Creator Studio has been a huge plus for me

column31: \u201d said Ruam Ghost. \u201cHaving onboarded onto Creator Studio
column32: coupled with the additional support received through the Meta media partnerships program
column33: I feel better equipped now to expand my team as I continue to grow my page.\"Stay focused
column34: stay consistent Both creators share one piece of advice for aspiring creators: Post regularly. Showing up consistently cements your Page as a place to invest in
column35: to spend time and engage.  Kop Dinh has found that focusing on his beat
column36: travel

column38: short-form video
column39: individual photos
column40: photo albums and links to articles. He\u2019s also found success posting Stories that peel back the curtain on his daily life
column41: as well as Stories that tease upcoming videos. \u201cThey\u2019re quick and easily accessible
column42: an easy way to connect
column43: \u201d he said.  Both Kop Dinh and Ruam Ghost have found that replying to comments helps generate engagement and build a meaningful relationship. \u201cWhen you comment

column47: have resulted in a 39% increase in in-stream ad revenue from January-August over the previous period.  \u201cI believe in quality
column48: not quantity

column7: "post_text": "ObiettiviThe Food Ranger voleva:ampliare il suo pubblico su Facebook;aumentare il tempo di visualizzazione;aumentare i ricavi.ApproccioPer raggiungere pi\u00f9 persone
column8: specialmente quelle al di fuori dell'Asia Pacifico
column9: The Food Ranger d\u00e0 molta importanza ai contenuti video. Riflette sul tipo di contenuto che pi\u00f9 probabilmente incuriosir\u00e0 le persone e le spinger\u00e0 non solo a guardare i suoi video
column10: ma anche a diventare fan.\"Do sempre la priorit\u00e0 ai contenuti che funzionano bene su Facebook\"
column11: afferma The Food Ranger. \"Cerco sempre contenuti che siano unici e intriganti
column12: in modo che siano accattivanti e catturino l'attenzione. Voglio che la gente voglia saperne di pi\u00f9.\"StrategiaNuovi video ogni giornoThe Food Ranger spesso pubblica due o tre video al giorno e li rende disponibili on demand su Facebook Watch. Nel suo processo di editing video
column13: applica una combinazione di best practice di Facebook
column14: come la formattazione ottimizzata per mobile e l'inclusione di sottotitoli
column15: oltre che insights ricavati da Creator Studio di Meta. Questo lo aiuta a garantire che i video che pubblica si adattino alle preferenze e ai comportamenti del pubblico di Facebook e che abbiano maggiori probabilit\u00e0 di attrarre nuovi spettatori."}

column3: "title": "Powcast Sports Utilizes Facebook Monetization Tools to Grow Brand and Business"
column8: 2021 vs. previous 8-month period:8.7x+ increase in Facebook followers gained vs. previous window (Page now has 440K+ total followers)*2.5x+ increase in 1+ minute video views (from 11 million+ to 39 million+)3.4x+ increase in Facebook video interactions (from 475K+ to 2.1 million+)** according to public CrowdTangle dataChallengePowcast Sports is the Facebook Page of Pow Salud
column9: a Filipino content creator who focuses on boxing
column10: basketball
column11: mixed martial arts
column12: and general sports news. With an expanding viewership and a vast social reach
column13: Powcast Sports is one of the fastest-growing and most innovative sports entities in the Philippines. The Page also promotes and celebrates other sports websites based in the Philippines. It allows users to post their own articles
column14: photos
column15: videos
column16: and more to help them fulfill their sportscasting dreams as well as promote sports events of their own. Pow Salud\u2019s main goals for his Facebook Page include:Building his brand into the premier sports-related media company in the PhilippinesLeveraging his Facebook presence to generate meaningful revenueStrategy \u2014 Build Your Business and Your CommunityPowcast Sports initially focused on long-form videos that allowed the Page to capitalize on in-stream ads. By posting monetizable videos
column17: Pow Salud could generate in-stream earnings from ads placed in his eligible uploads.However
column18: in more recent months
column19: Pow Salud pivoted his video strategy towards Facebook Live rather than VOD uploads
column20: to allow for more real-time engagement with his followers. Through his experience with in-stream ads
column21: Pow Salud decided to try Live in-stream ads
column22: a new Facebook monetization option that allows creators to profit off of advertisements placed within their Facebook Lives.Si \u00e8 verificato un erroreStiamo riscontrando problemi con la riproduzione di questo video.Scopri di pi\u00f9Pow Salud further expanded his Facebook Live revenue streams by enabling user-pay products like Facebook Stars. Stars are a tool that allow you to monetize your Live videos. Viewers can buy Stars and send to you while you're Live
column23: or can send Stars on previous Live videos that had Stars enabled. For every Star you receive
column24: Facebook pays you $0.01."}

"title": "Unlock your creativity with Reels on Facebook"
column7: "post_text": "Cosa sono i reel su Facebook?  I reel sono video brevi e coinvolgenti con musica
column8: audio
column9: effetti in realt\u00e0 aumentata
column10: overlay del testo e molto altro
column11: che ora puoi creare anche con l'app Facebook sul tuo dispositivo mobile. I reel sono condivisi direttamente nella sezione Notizie dei fan
column12: mentre il pubblico che non ti segue pu\u00f2 vederli nell'area Reels dedicata della sezione Notizie: in questo modo avr\u00e0 la possibilit\u00e0 di scoprirti e apprezzare le tue creazioni.Scopri cosa puoi fare con ReelsDai libero sfogo alla creativit\u00e0Inizia a creare reel sul tuo dispositivo mobile nella parte superiore della sezione Notizie o selezionando \"Crea\" nell'area Reels dedicata. Puoi registrare un clip (o una serie di clip) in tempo reale o caricare uno o pi\u00f9 video pre-registrati gi\u00e0 presenti nella galleria del telefono oppure usare una combinazione di clip in tempo reale e pre-registrati. Prima di condividere un reel
column13: puoi modificare e tagliare clip fino a ottenere la lunghezza desiderata o aggiungere effetti
column14: adesivi e testo. Avrai accesso a un'ampia gamma di strumenti creativi di modifica
column15: tra cui: Audio: aggiungi un brano dalla libreria musicale di Facebook o usa un audio originale. L'audio originale ti sar\u00e0 attribuito e sar\u00e0 reso disponibile all'intera community di Facebook per la creazione dei reel.Velocit\u00e0: accelera o rallenta parte del video o dell'audio selezionato.Effetti: seleziona uno dei tanti effetti per registrare pi\u00f9 clip con effetti diversi.Timer: registra un clip a mani libere usando il timer.Raggiungi un nuovo pubblicoI reel consentono di condividere creazioni con amici e follower e rendono i tuoi contenuti visibili all'ampia community di Facebook.Condivisione dei reel: quando il reel \u00e8 pronto per la condivisione
column16: puoi aggiungere una descrizione
column17: hashtag e taggare i tuoi amici. Seleziona un pubblico predefinito: hai la possibilit\u00e0 di selezionare un pubblico per il reel per stabilire chi potr\u00e0 vederlo dopo la condivisione. L'impostazione predefinita per i reel dei creator di et\u00e0 superiore ai 18 anni \u00e8 Tutti. Puoi selezionare un pubblico predefinito per i nuovi reel o modificare la scelta del pubblico per i singoli reel in qualsiasi momento.Raggiungi i tuoi fan e nuovi gruppi di pubblico: i reel possono aiutarti a far crescere la tua community rendendo i tuoi contenuti visibili a tutte le persone su Facebook. I reel vengono visualizzati nella sezione Notizie dei follower e sono disponibili per chi ancora non ti conosce nell'area Reels dedicata della sezione Notizie. Consiglia i tuoi reel di Instagram su Facebook: se crei gi\u00e0 reel su Instagram
column18: puoi consentire a Facebook di consigliarli a nuovi gruppi di pubblico su Facebook
column19: raggiungendo pi\u00f9 persone. Fatti notareCon i suggerimenti forniti di seguito potrai distinguerti dalla massa e far scoprire i tuoi reel a pi\u00f9 persone. Crea reel realistici: pensa a contenuti in cui le persone possano riconoscersi e rendili tuoi. Tieni il passo con le tendenze
column20: le sfide e le canzoni del momento e rielaborale aggiungendo il tuo tocco personale. Coinvolgi il pubblico: che si tratti di aggiustare auto
column21: cucinare o ballare
column22: crea reel che dimostrino le tue capacit\u00e0 e il tuo talento unico. Prova diversi tipi di contenuti
column23: come tutorial o sketch comici
column24: e scopri quali sono i pi\u00f9 apprezzati dal pubblico. Dato che l'obiettivo \u00e8 tenere alto il coinvolgimento del pubblico
column25: verifica che i contenuti siano interessanti e divertenti. Dai vita ai tuoi reel con effetti unici
column26: musica e testo.Racconta una storia: racconta storie complete e prova ad aggiungere qualcosa di sorprendente o inatteso per mantenere alto l'interesse degli spettatori. Crea uno script per il reel prima di registrarlo. Stabilisci come sar\u00e0 ogni clip e scegli il brano musicale pi\u00f9 adatto da abbinare. Sii una fonte di ispirazione: invita gli altri a creare i propri reel: lancia una semplice sfida
column27: sfrutta un momento culturale o un momento di vita quotidiana in cui chiunque possa riconoscersi. GuadagnaA luglio abbiamo annunciato un investimento di oltre 1\u00a0miliardo di dollari destinato ai creator che opereranno su Facebook e Instagram nel 2022. A partire da oggi sono disponibili i Reels Play
column28: nuovi programmi di bonus su Facebook e Instagram che consentono di guadagnare dai reel condivisi. Reels Play su Facebook verser\u00e0 un bonus ai creator idonei i cui reel otterranno almeno 1000 visualizzazioni in un periodo di 30\u00a0giorni su questa piattaforma. I reel dei creator che partecipano al programma (disponibile solo su invito) devono soddisfare le nostre Normative sulla monetizzazione dei contenuti e
column29: ai fini del bonus
column30: i contenuti dovranno essere di propriet\u00e0 del creator. Al momento
column31: il programma di bonus Reels Play su Facebook \u00e8 disponibile solo su invito. I creator invitati riceveranno una notifica nell'app Facebook e in Creator Studio e potranno iscriversi e trovare maggiori informazioni qui. Il programma Reels Play su Instagram retribuir\u00e0 i creator di Instagram idonei per le visualizzazioni dei reel su Instagram e Facebook. I creator idonei alla partecipazione al programma di bonus Reels Play su Instagram riceveranno un avviso direttamente nella propria dashboard per professionisti nell'app Instagram. "}

column3: "title": "Why Every Nonprofit Should Leverage Facebook Fundraisers and In-Stream Ads"
column7: "post_text": "Since he started Special Books by Special Kids
column8: Chris Ulmer has interviewed hundreds of disabled and neurodiverse individuals of all ages. Ulmer
column9: whose passion project began six years ago while he worked as a special education teacher in Florida
column10: publishes his video interviews on Facebook and has built out a sustainable nonprofit organization that just brought on its first intern: one of the first children that he interviewed who\u2019s now 18 years old.One of Special Books by Special Kids\u2019 most sustainable income sources has been Facebook
column11: where Ulmer has built a network of 3.8M followers. The devoted community is known to raise money for disabled kids and adults in need of medical help or living expenses\u2014totaling over $1 million given throughout the organization\u2019s existence. Facebook covers all processing fees for nonprofit fundraisers
column12: so 100% of what\u2019s raised on the platform goes toward furthering the organization\u2019s mission.\u201cThis year alone
column13: Facebook Fundraisers are on pace to be a six-figure revenue source for our organization
column14: \u201d said Ulmer
column15: who runs Special Books by Special Kids full time with his partner
column16: Alyssa Porter. \u201cOur ad revenue on Facebook is already over a six-figure revenue source per year. That\u2019s two separate six-figure revenue sources on Facebook alone.\u201d \u201cIf you\u2019re a nonprofit that makes videos to serve your mission
column17: Facebook is the best platform to use
column18: since it\u2019s built to make it easy to post videos and optimize their performance
column19: \u201d Ulmer continued. \u201cThe algorithm helps grow our community
column20: introducing the people we feature to a worldwide audience. Through their fundraising tools
column21: Facebook provides our organization the means necessary to travel the world and record those stories from diverse cultures.\u201dWe caught up with Ulmer to hear more about how he\u2019s used Facebook to grow Special Books by Special Kids
column22: which tools have been best for his site and what he\u2019d advise for creators who are just starting out.Chris Ulmer and his partner
column23: Alyssa PorterTell us about Special Books by Special Kids.Ulmer: \u201cThe Page grew from a tiny blog I managed as a teacher to something that now reaches people around the world. We started this in 2015
column24: and in 2016 I started doing it full-time \u2013 the money from Facebook is a gigantic portion of our annual budget. We\u2019re now able to allocate money toward securing the future of the nonprofit
column25: and that\u2019s in huge part to Facebook.\u201d\u201cI always wanted to provide people a platform to tell their stories in an authentic way that didn\u2019t sensationalize them. And Facebook provides us a way to do that: nothing is distorted
column26: nothing is edited down. Advocates share their stories
column27: and our audience listens. They are able to learn directly from the person who is impacted by disability. I\u2019m just grateful that Facebook has allowed us to do this.\u201dHow has Facebook enabled Special Books by Special Kids to achieve its mission?\u201cMainly
column28: Facebook has helped us find a community of people who are interested in learning about disability and becoming more inclusive. Without this platform and its ability to build a community
column29: none of this would be possible. The monetization features are also necessary to sustaining our nonprofit.\u201d\u201cThrough Facebook alone
column30: we have two different revenue sources\u2014Fundraisers/Donations and In-Stream Ads\u2014which are huge for us. I use Automatic Placements for all our video advertising. That puts the advertisement in the best place to promote viewer retention throughout the video. So
column31: through the beauty of Facebook\u2019s algorithm
column32: I don\u2019t have to think about anything. I can focus on video production. Facebook\u2019s Creator platform is easy and intuitive
column33: which really takes the stress off us and allows us to focus on what\u2019s truly important: the human connection and strength of our content.\u201d Have you had success monetizing your business through Fundraisers and Donations?\u201cFacebook Fundraisers are a main reason we are able to focus full-time on Special Books by Special Kids. Our organization brings in an extraordinary amount of revenue via Facebook Fundraisers every day; this year
column34: we\u2019re averaging over $300 a day. This is achieved through utilizing only the base systems in place. It\u2019s not something we proactively promote
column35: we\u2019ve never actually said
column36: \u2018Hey
column37: make a fundraiser for us.\u2019 People just do it. Sometimes Facebook gives us a little prompt
column38: saying [to others]
column39: \u2018It\u2019s your birthday! You can make a fundraiser for an organization.\u2019 This allows us to continue sharing these stories and provide grants to many of the families who are featured.\u201d \u201cPeople who connect with our content are inspired to fundraise for those we feature. We had one story of a father with a brain injury who was a wheelchair user and struggled to leave his home to enjoy life outdoors with his daughter. The community raised $70K for a wheelchair accessible van for him and his family. We\u2019ve had community-led campaigns to raise funds for medical expenses and research for rare conditions. It allows us to focus on the content and not worry about the funding.\u201dHas the way you\u2019ve approached storytelling on Facebook changed since you launched your Page
column40: given the positive feedback you\u2019ve received?\u201cOur videos have gotten longer. When we started out
column42: our videos were one to two minutes in length because that\u2019s the content I saw being posted to Facebook by others. I quickly realized
column43: that\u2019s not enough time to tell someone\u2019s story. I decided to experiment
column44: create longer videos and see the impact those have. I started with 10 minutes
column45: then 30 minutes
column46: even 45 minutes (in 2019) and the audience responded positively. That\u2019s when growth and revenue really took off. Our audience wanted that type of content
column47: and it was validating to see the results.\u201dWhat would you recommend to creators who want to develop a channel like Special Books by Special Kids?\u201cI organize videos into playlists. Here\u2019s why: I think about someone just diagnosed with a disability
column48: or the parent of a child. They can come to our Page and find a folder of people with similar situations
column49: from all over the world
column50: and meet people facing similar challenges.\u201d\u201cOne of the things we get on Facebook that we don\u2019t get on other platforms is the community: You see the people; see the names; the faces; you feel that community. We have people that comment on every single video
column51: since 2015 when it was just the classroom blog. It\u2019s neat to see the same people coming back. Since Facebook is tied to personal identity
column52: it creates such a special community that doesn\u2019t come across on other platforms.\u201dSix years
column53: hundreds of videos. You\u2019ve got to have a few good stories about that community.\u201cWe filmed a video with a guy named Jeff in 2017. A few years later a community member saw it and now they are engaged. The woman
column55: lived in Colorado and Jeff lived in New Orleans. Now they\u2019re planning the wedding together and I\u2019m invited! I know it sounds cheesy
column56: but our community is like a family. We really are.\u201dWhat\u2019s next for Special Books by Special Kids?\u201cWe are currently focused not only on the immediate future of SBSK
column57: but the coming decades as well. Revenue from Facebook allows us to plan long-term for the future of our organization. It allows us to future-proof our mission
column58: and we are now positioned to deal with any changes in the creator economy. This allows us to focus on creating a comprehensive resource that will educate those around the world on disability for years to come.\"\u201cIn the more immediate future
column59: we have our very first internship this fall. A former student of mine with a disability who starred in our first videos
column60: we\u2019re teaching him how to be a content creator so he can make an eight part series on what it\u2019s like to live with his condition. Everything from how he lives with it to how he got accepted to college and more. We will empower him to create a resource for other people living with his disability and the people who support them. It is a paid internship
column61: we\u2019re pulling in other creators who can provide perspective and advice and at the end
column62: he will own the platforms he creates and be prepared to continue making content.\" "}

column3: "title": "Understanding Verification on Facebook and Instagram"
column8: la verifica \u00e8 un modo per permettere alle persone di sapere se gli account di rilievo che stanno seguendo o cercando corrispondono esattamente a chi dicono di essere. In altre parole
column9: \u00e8 un modo per far sapere alle persone quali account sono davvero autentici e di rilievo. I badge di verifica rappresentano sostegno da parte nostra e non li consideriamo un simbolo che denota importanza.Abbiamo reso pi\u00f9 semplice la procedura di richiesta della verifica aggiornando il modulo presente nell'app. Abbiamo implementato aggiornamenti che permettono di capire meglio cosa bisogna inviare ai fini della verifica e per essere ancora pi\u00f9 trasparenti circa i nostri requisiti. Questi requisiti sono uguali su Facebook e Instagram.Come faccio a richiedere la verifica del mio account?Per farlo
column10: devi essere in linea con le nostre Condizioni d'uso e Linee guida della community. Durante la procedura di richiesta (disponibile direttamente nell'app)
column11: \u00e8 necessario soddisfare questi requisiti: L'account deve rappresentare una persona reale
column12: un'azienda registrata o un'entit\u00e0. L'account deve essere l'unico presente corrispondente alla persona o all'azienda che rappresenta. Anche le entit\u00e0 di rilievo (ad esempio animali domestici o pubblicazioni) sono idonee. Pu\u00f2 essere verificato un solo account per persona o azienda
column13: ad eccezione di account specifici disponibili in diverse lingue. L'account deve essere pubblico e avere una sezione Informazioni
column14: un'immagine del profilo e almeno un post. L'account deve rappresentare una persona
column15: un brand o un'entit\u00e0 ben noti e molto cercati. Verifichiamo gli account che compaiono in diversi organi di informazione. Non consideriamo contenuti a pagamento o promozionali come fonti di informazione. Su Instagram e Facebook
column16: abbiamo di recente ampliato il nostro elenco di organi di informazione al fine di proporre un'offerta pi\u00f9 diversificata che include anche ulteriori contenuti multimediali delle categorie Black
column17: LGBTQ+ e Latinx e pi\u00f9 organi di informazione da tutto il mondo. Grazie agli aggiornamenti
column18: le persone possono ora condividere informazioni sul loro pubblico
column19: il territorio dove sono pi\u00f9 popolari e aggiungere fino a cinque articoli tratti da organi di informazione per aiutare i nostri team ad avere pi\u00f9 elementi utili su cui basarsi quando verificano le richieste.Per aiutare le persone a distinguere meglio gli account di rilievo e favorire interazioni autentiche su Facebook
column20: stiamo iniziando a verificare e contattare attivamente gli account che soddisfano i nostri criteri di verifica. Ad esempio
column21: potrebbe trattarsi di account di creator e personaggi pubblici che sono gi\u00e0 stati verificati su Instagram e pertanto sono idonei alla verifica su Facebook. Che cosa significa e NON significa una verifica?In parole semplici
column22: la verifica \u00e8 una garanzia di autenticit\u00e0 e del rilievo dell'account. Non \u00e8 un sostegno da parte nostra ed essere un account verificato non significa che il contenuto verr\u00e0 favorito dai nostri sistemi
column23: ad esempio per quanto riguarda dove verr\u00e0 mostrato. Cerchiamo di garantire l'imparzialit\u00e0 della procedura di verifica basandoci su fonti come una copertura stampa credibile ed esaminando l'impatto culturale della persona. Ad esempio: al momento
column24: la community di cui fa parte parla molto di quella persona? Di recente \u00e8 diventata virale? Purtroppo
column25: siamo consapevoli che gli account verificati possono comportare un rischio per la sicurezza dei titolari dell'account. Gli hacker possono tentare di impadronirsi di un account verificato per vendere il badge (e il seguito guadagnato con tanti sforzi). Consigliamo caldamente a tutti gli account verificati di configurare l'autenticazione a due fattori per proteggersi da violazioni e di fare attenzione a scam e tentativi di furto d'identit\u00e0. Continuiamo a espandere la visibilit\u00e0 dei badge di verifica per rendere pi\u00f9 facile l'identificazione di post e commenti provenienti da Pagine e profili di rilievo e autentici. Posso trasferire il mio badge di verifica a un altro account?Gli account verificati non possono cambiare il nome dell'account o trasferire quella verifica a un account diverso. Lo scopo del badge blu \u00e8 far sapere alle persone che l'account \u00e8 stato esaminato e ne abbiamo confermato la relativa identit\u00e0.Che cosa succede se rileviamo una verifica sospetta o dannosa? Se ci accorgiamo che la verifica \u00e8 stata ottenuta in modo dannoso o che una persona sta vendendo account verificati ad altri
column26: agiremo di conseguenza. Effettuiamo pulizie regolari sia all'interno che all'esterno della piattaforma per trovare e rimuovere utenti malintenzionati da Facebook. Scopri di pi\u00f9 sulle linee guida della community di Facebook qui.Implementiamo continuamente modifiche per migliorare l'esperienza di tutti su Instagram e Facebook e speriamo che questo post aiuti a spiegare come funziona la procedura di verifica. Per ulteriori informazioni sulla verifica
column27: consulta il Centro assistenza."}
