column3: "title": "How Gen Halilintar Grew Their Brand & Increased Video Views"
"title": "How to engage celebrities for social good initiatives on Facebook"
column7: "post_text": "US$5B+Raised by our community on Facebook and Instagram for the causes they care about. In the midst of a global pandemic
column8: social good initiatives are more important than ever. Facebook serves as a powerful conduit between social good organisations and the amazing humans that donate their money
column9: resources and time to help those in need.Another powerful element to social good campaigns is celebrity. Celebrities can influence a great number of people and effect real change.Throughout the pandemic
column10: Vietnam has been a hotbed of social good causes. The Facebook-driven #OneVietnam campaign brought together 72 public figures - both international and local - who joined the campaign. They were joined by many media organisations to raise over 10 billion Vietnamese Dong (USD$495
column11: 000) in cash and in-kind donations and resources that were sent to Red Cross Vietnam to help those impacted by the pandemic.We caught up with APAC celebrities and media leaders to ask: What drives a celebrity to get involved in certain social good causes
column12: but not others? How do they excite fans about the causes close to their hearts? HOW CELEBRITIES PREFER TO BE CONTACTED \u201cUsually
column13: I am approached through my Page or my manager. The approach doesn't matter to me
column14: what\u2019s important is the campaign's purpose and meaning to the community.\u201d -Sam
column15: Vietnam Public Figure\u201cThey approach me through direct messages
column16: emails and calls. I would prefer to be contacted by email.\u201d -Woody
column17: Talk Show Host and Thailand Public Figure\u201cNormally they will contact the Page directly. We\u2019re okay with any approach as long as it\u2019s professional - introducing who they are
column18: what they\u2019re expecting from us and how we may work with them smoothly.\u201d -Mr Buu Dien Do
column19: Founder and CEO
column20: Dien Quan\u201cNormally
column21: the social good organisations send information to my email. That's the way I prefer.\u201d -H\u2019hen Nie\u0302
column22: Miss Universe Vietnam 2017 Pictured left to right: Sam
column23: Woody
column24: Buu Dien Do; Dien Quan
column25: H\u2019hen Nie\u0302WHY CELEBRITIES SAY \u2018YES\u2019 \u201cThe factors I\u2019m very interested in are the positive contribution to society by social good organisations
column26: the conformity with my orientation (education and environment). My team will research and check to get more information about social good organisations. If they don't match
column27: I will say no.\u201d -H\u2019hen Nie\u0302
column28: Miss Universe Vietnam 2017 \u201cThe first factor to evaluate a social good organization is what is the purpose or objective of this organization? What are the core values it brings to society? The second is whether the job is suitable for my ability or not.\u201c -Sam
column29: Vietnam Public Figure\u201cI would say yes If they are aligned with our goals and social values. I would also have my team look over the request and see if my support will really be beneficial to their cause.\u201c -Woody
column30: Talk Show Host and Thailand Public Figure\u201cWe need to clarify: When and where does the organization originate? What is their mission and vision? What do we need to do for the campaign? If it\u2019s meaningful and matches our schedule
column31: we will try our best\u201c -Mr Buu Dien Do
column32: Founder and CEO
column33: Dien Quan\u201cThe most important aspect for us to say Yes is transparency. Secondly is the link between an organisation and official government or famous global organisations. Along with their purpose and the management team\u2019s reputation.\u201d -Mr Pham Minh Tien - CEO and Founder Yeah1HOW CELEBRITIES INVOLVE FACEBOOK FANS \u201cI share information about social good organizations to my fans through a storyline in photos
column34: videos and livestream. I talk about specific social good activities that I have participated in
column35: and I invite my fans to accompany me. I really want to share inspiration
column36: positive energy and my experience with my fans.\u201d -H\u2019hen Nie\u0302
column37: Miss Universe Vietnam 2017 \u201cI convey the message and meaning of the program through articles
column38: photos and videos posted on my Facebook profile and Fan Page.\u201d -Sam
column39: Vietnam Public Figure\u201cAudiences love to share touching
column40: emotional and meaningful things that bring value to themselves and their friends. For example
column41: during the COVID-19 social distancing time
column42: we produced home cooking video tutorials with artists.\u201d -Ms Ngo Thi Bich Hanh - Senior Vice President of BHD\u201cWhen it comes to conveying meaningful messages to our audience
column43: video is one of the most effective mediums to use. In the #VideoForVietnam campaign
column44: we worked with famous artists and creators on video content that would incite pride and create national solidarity. We utilized social challenges via the #Challenge hashtag which quickly made the campaign go viral.\u201d -Mr Nguyen Hung Anh
column45: Communication Director at YanPictured left to right: Mr Nguyen Hung Anh; Ms Ngo Thi Bich Hanh; Mr Pham Minh Tien #OneVietnam In partnership with Red Cross Vietnam
column46: this Facebook social good initiative kicked off with a 1-hour livestream event organised by and hosted on Facebook. Vietnamese celebrities and partners addressed the challenges of Covid-19 and called for the community to come together and help each other.The #HomePossibleChallenge called for people to use their creativity and turn impossible outdoor activities into indoor ones! #VideoForVietnam Over 72 influential public figures from Vietnam and beyond came together to promote domestic tourism and economic recovery during the pandemic. International stars from Thailand
column47: Taiwan
column48: Korea
column49: Philippines
column50: China and local heroes shared their favourite domestic travel stories and these were replayed in traditional media
column51: there have been more than 35 pieces of media coverage that have mentioned and promoted these campaigns.RESULTS 1.6M+ interactions and posts for the #VideoForVietnamChallenge* 1.2M+ Interactions and posts for the #socialforgoodvn hashtag***Aug 1
column55: 2020  Results are self-reported and not identically repeatable. Generally expected individual results will differ. THE POWER OF FACEBOOK PLATFORM \u201cSo far
column56: we have seen that Facebook is the most powerful and effective partner for Social Good. For impactful campaigns that foster good awareness about social topics like #VideoForVietnam
column57: or campaigns for developing funds to help people in need like #SocialForGoodVN\u201d -Mr Nguyen Hung Anh
column58: Communication Director at Yan\u201cFacebook is indeed a strong and powerful partner in reaching the required target audience for social good campaigns. I personally feel there is a highly mature audience who follow and interact with my Fan Page when we post about social good.\u201d -Woody
column59: Talk Show Host and Thailand Public Figure\u201cPositive messages can be spread easily via Facebook. People can share and call for donations
column60: easily supporting the organisations that care for their communities.\u201d -Mr Pham Minh Tien - CEO and Founder Yeah1POSITIVE FAN ENGAGEMENT \u201cI appreciate that my fans are always excited and willing to support and accompany me. In fact
column61: social good activities are bringing more and more benefits to everyone
column62: so people are also increasingly interested in and supporting these social activities and campaigns.\u201d -H\u2019hen Nie\u0302
column63: Miss Universe Vietnam 2017 \u201cMy fans react very positively to the cause/programs that I participated in. \u201c -Sam
column64: Vietnam Public Figure\u201cIt's mostly positive. We tend to get positive feedback and high engagement from our followers
column65: when we post about social good.\u201c -Woody
column66: Talk Show Host and Thailand Public Figure\u201cWe receive tons of positive feedback from the community when we share information about the social good organisations we are involved with. For #SocialForGoodVN - Joining hands to fight Covid-19
column67: we got lots of positive feedback and donations from our fans.\u201d -Mr Nguyen Hung Anh
